New Records: Australia posted the highest score of the T20 World Cup to date
Key Match Events: David Warner and Travis Head blitzed 70 runs in the first five overs
Adam Zampa made the difference in England's lacklustre run chase
Will Jacks conceded three sixes in his first four balls
England fell away badly after Zampa accounted for both of their openers
Australia's strong finish was led by Marcus Stoinis, Tim David and Matthew Wade
Zampa struck with his first ball, which crashed into the top of Salt's off stump
Will Jacks picked out Starc at long-off, who took an excellent diving catch off Stoinis
Pre-Game Insights: England opened the bowling with spin from both ends, but it didn't work
The dimensions played a major role at Kensington Oval: one square boundary was nine metres shorter than the other
Post-Match Reflections: The result is not terminal for England's title defence, but they have one point from their first two matches and face an anxious week ahead in Antigua
Australia outplayed England in Barbados to leave the defending champions sweating on their qualification for the Super 8s
Miscellaneous Highlights: The dry pitch was a major factor in the match, with both teams struggling to adjust to it
Australia's total relied on cameos throughout their batting line-up rather than one substantial innings
England's middle order failed to adjust to the dry pitch quickly enough against a clinical Australian attack
Others: The match was played at Kensington Oval in Barbados
The match was part of the ICC Men's T20 World Cup 2024
